raw_text:
Hearts of Oak 3-2 Cotonsport
 
 Hearts of Oak set up an all Ghanaian Confederation Cup final with a 3-2 win over Cameroon's Cotonsport Garoua in Accra on Sunday.
 
 The win for Hearts means they will play Asante Kotoko in the two-leg final, after the Kumasi team qualified from Group A on Saturday. In the other Group B game Cameroon's
 
 beat
 
 of South Africa 3-2 in Douala, neither side could have qualified for the final. Hearts of Oak started the game needing a win to qualify for the final while Cotonsport only needed to avoid defeat to go through. Louis Agyemang scored the first two goals for Hearts either side of half time before Ben Don Bortey scored the third. Hearts looked set for a comfortable win but Cotonsport staged a late fight back scoring twice late on. First of all Boukar Makaji scored in the 89th minute and then 3 minutes into injury time at the end of the game Andre Nzame III was on target. But it was too little too late for the Cameroonians and Hearts held on to win the game and a place in the final. The first leg of the final will be played in Accra on the weekend of 27-28 November and the second leg two weeks later on the 11 December in Kumasi. In the other Group B game Cameroon's Sable Batie took the lead in the 35th minute through Kemadjou before Santos equalised on the hour mark thanks to Thokozani Xaba . Bernard Ngom put Sable ahead just five minutes later and then Ernest Nfor settled the game on 68 minutes. Ruben Cloete scored the South African sides consolation with just three minutes left on the clock.
llama3.2:1b:
Hearts of Oak won 3-2 against Cameroon's Cotonsport Garoua in Accra to advance to the two-leg final, while Cotonsport needed a win to qualify.

Hearts of Oak qualified from Group A after beating South Africa 3-2. They play Asante Kotoko in the final.

Cotonsport beat South Africa 3-2.
llama3.2:3b: Hearts of Oak defeated Cotonsport Garoua 3-2 in Accra to reach the Confederation Cup final, beating Cameroon's team and ensuring Asante Kotoko advanced from Group A.
gemma2:2b:
Hearts of Oak won 3-2 against Cotonsport to qualify for the Confederation Cup final. The Ghanaian team will face Asante Kotoko in the two-leg final.  The first leg will be played in Accra, and the second leg in Kumasi. 
In the other Group B game, Sable Batie defeated South African side Santos.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Heart of Oak won a Group B final over Cotonsport in Accra, Ghana, 3-2. Hearts secured a place in the final, while Cotonsport were eliminated. Heart of Oak started well but had to fight back to win.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Hearts of Oak won a 3-2 match against Cotonsport Garoua in Ghana's Confederation Cup final, qualifying for a two-leg final against Asante Kotoko. Cameroon's Sable Batie led but Santos and Ernest Nfor equalized, and Ruben Cloete scored the consolation goal for South Africa. Hearts of Oak will face Asante Kotoko in the final leg in Accra.
qwen2.5:3b: Hearts of Oak won a tight 3-2 Confederation Cup match against Cotonsport, securing their place in the final with a win and qualification from Group A. The victory means they will face Asante Kotoko in the two-legged final. In the other Group B game, Cameroon's Sable Batie lost to Santos of South Africa after initially taking the lead. Hearts of Oak had to win to qualify while Cotonsport only needed not to lose; Louis Agyemang scored early and Ben Don Bortey added a third goal before Cotonsport staged an impressive late fightback. The first leg of the final will be played in Accra on November 27-28, with the second leg in Kumasi two weeks later.
opencoder:1.5b: "Hearts of Oak's win over Cameroon's Cotonsport Garoua means they will play Asante Kotoko in the two-leg final, following the Kumasi team from Group A on Sunday. In the final game, neither side could have qualified for the second leg as South Africa won only 3-2 to go through. Hearts of Oak starts the game with a win to qualify for the final while Cotonsport only needed to defeat it to proceed. Louis Agyemang scores two goals on half time before Ben Don Bortey scores a goal in Douala. Hearts showed they would be set but Cotonsport struggled to score a comfortable late punch. Boukar Makaji scores in the 89th minute and then Andre Nzame III is on target for the Cameroonians. But it's too late for the Cameroonians, Hearts hold onto the win and take their place in the final. The first leg of the final will be played on Accra and the second leg two weeks later on 11 December in Kumasi. In the Group B game, Cameroon's Sable Batie scores the lead in the 35th minute through Kemadjou before Santos equalised thanks to Thokozani Xaba. Bernard Ngom puts Sable ahead by five minutes and then Ernest Nfor sets the game on 68 minutes. Ruben Cloete scores the South African side with just three minutes left on the clock."

Hearts of Oak 3-2 Cotonsport (Cotonsport Garoua) in Accra on Sunday marked a significant win for Hearts, securing their place in the two-leg final against Asante Kotoko. The game was tight, with both teams making crucial plays. Louis scored early and twice later, while Ben Don Bortey contributed his goals. However, Cotonsport managed to keep alive their efforts with Boukar Makaji scoring first in the 89th minute and Andre Nzame III scoring late at the end of extra time. Sable Batie took charge with a goal just five minutes into the second half, but South Africa's only other goal came on 68 minutes when Ernest Nfor settled the game. Ruben Cloete also scored for the Sable side with three minutes remaining. The Heart's victory secured them in the competition, while Cotonsport's loss highlighted their struggles to qualify for the second leg against Asante Kotoko.
tinyllama:1.1b: Hearts of Oak set up an all-Ghanaian Confederation Cup final with a 3-2 win over Cameroon's Cotonsport Garoua in Accra on Sunday. The win qualifies Heart of Oak for the final, where they will face Asante Kotoko. While Cotonsport qualified from Group A, neither team could make it to the final. Hearts of Oak started the game needing a win to secure their spot in the final, while Cotonsport held on late in the match to avoid defeat and qualify for the final as well. The Confederation Cup final will take place on November 27-28 in Accra, with the second leg two weeks later on December 11 in Kumasi. Meanwhile, Group B's first leg of the final between Heart of Oak and Cameron's Sable Batie was won by Heart of Oak, who took the lead through Kemadjou in the 35th minute before Santos equalised with Thokozani Xaba on the hour mark. Bernard Ngom put Heart of Oak ahead for good just five minutes later, with Ernest Nfor securing the match's final goal with just three minutes left on the clock.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The all-Ghanaian Confederation Cup final between Hearts of Oak and Cotonsport Garoua in Accra resulted in a 3-2 win for Hearts, advancing the team to play Asante Kotoko in the two-leg final. The match was played on Sunday, November 18th and both teams started needing a victory to qualify for the final. In the first half, Hearts of Oak looked set for a comfortable win but Cotonsport fought back with goals from Boukar Makaji and Andre Nzame III, who scored in the 89th minute. However, it was too little too late for the Cameroonians and Hearts held on to win the game and a place in the final. The second leg of the match will be played in Accra on the weekend of November 27th and the second leg two weeks later on December 11th. In the other Group B match, Cameroon's Sable Batie secured their place in the final with a 1-0 victory over South Africa's Santos. Thokozani Xaba and Ernest Nfor scored for Sable Botto while Bernard Ngom scored for Santos to set up a thrilling finale with just three minutes left on the clock.
phi:2.7b: Hearts of Oak won 3-2 against Cotonsport in the Confederation Cup final, securing their spot to play Asante Kotoko in the two-legged final which will take place on 27-28 November and 11 December respectively. Cameroon'S South Africa lost 3-2 to Sable Batie with Ngom scoring for the latter team.
orca-mini:3b: Hearts of Oak qualified for the Confederation Cup final by defeating Cotonsport Garoua 3-2 in Accra. Louis Agyemang scored two goals for the Ghanaian team, while Ben Don Bortey and Andre Nzame III scored one each. Cotonsport managed to score twice late on in the second half but it was not enough to prevent Hearts from winning the game. The first leg of the final will take place in Accra, with the second leg two weeks later in Kumasi. In Group B, Cameroon's Sable Batie took the lead against South Africa's Santos with a goal by Kemadjou. Bernard Ngom put Sable ahead and Ernest Nfor scored for the South Africans before Thokozani Xaba equalized for Santos. Ruben Cloete scored the South African team's consolation with just three minutes left on the clock.

However, it was not enough to overcome Hearts of Oak, who qualified for the final. The first leg will take place on November 27-28, with the second leg in Kumasi on December 11.

The first leg of the final will be held in Accra on November 27-28, followed by the second leg in Kumasi on December 11.
